column4: I need some help setting up one of my nics in a Ubuntu 10.10 server to work on multiple vlans (accept a vlan trunk 802.1q). Can anyone help out?
have you checked http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=703387
will look into it, thanks
when I run ifup eth0.500 I get the following error "ERROR: trying to add VLAN 500 to IF -:etho0:- error: File exists"
the link I gave you hasn't helped you?
well, I've tried everything in it, but I can't ping the server from another machine on the vlan
did you setup the routes so it uses the correct vlan tag?
on the switch?
or do I do that on each of the machines?
sorry was cut off, vlan has to be configured at least on the switch. If you use portbased tagging, not every machine has to be configured but it depends on your setup
are you familiar with cisco ios?
just a bit, enough to hate them :) So I won't be of much help
ok. my switch says the port the server is on is in trunking mode and will accept vlan 2, 3, and 500. a machine on vlan 2 should be able to ping the server, right?
Last time I wanted a Cisco core router setup I got so pissed because of  the salesmans attitude that I try to avoid them
yes as lonf as the machine nows that the route to your server goes over vlan 2
it can but when then route doesn't force a vlan tag the switch won't deliver it
so to start debugging you should check if the ping packets are send with a vlan tag
so do I have to run through that setup in that link you gave me on all the machines I want to start to use vlans?
no but you need to assure that the PC from which to send pings sets the vlan tag
route add -host <ip> dev eth0.2
alright, I give up for now. thanks for your help
I know it's hard stuff. Good luck
one suggestion, set one port one the cisco as debug port and use some traffic analyzer to see the packets, so you can check the vlan settings
